# Overview

We explore the correlation and relationship between Gross Domestic Product per capita, Sanitation Level, and Average Life Expectancy of Nations in the year 2009.

# Introduction

This presentation demonstrates the capabilities of Bivariate Analysis on datasets, to infer relationship between various features of the Population. The features of interest in this presentation are:

::: {.incremental}
- **Logarithm of GDP per Capita**: Logarithm of Gross Domestic Product divided by Mid-year Population. Indication the general economic prosperity level.
- **Basic Sanitation Access**: Percentage of people using at least basic Sanitation facilities which are not shared with other households.
- **Life Expectancy**: The average number of years a newborn child would live if current mortality patterns were to stay the same.
:::
